com.hsenid.assignment1

Class Subjects

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.hsenid.assignment1.Subjects

  • class Subjects
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents the set of subjects that is offered in the class. Contains the data of all subjects in a collection, and the common operations that needs to be performed over the data set.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private java.io.BufferedReader buf
      This is used for the input capturing purposes within the class.
      private java.lang.String[] subjects
      An array of strings that contains the subject names.

      Plain constructor that interactively builds the instance with user's inputs.

      Instantiates the class with the given array of subjects.

      Changes an existing subject's name to a given value.

    • Field Detail

      • buf

        private java.io.BufferedReader buf
        This is used for the input capturing purposes within the class.

      • subjects

        private java.lang.String[] subjects
        An array of strings that contains the subject names. JVM generated indices of the entries are used as the identifiers inside the com.hsenid.assignment1.Student.

    • Method Detail

      • indexOfSubject

        public int indexOfSubject(java.lang.String subject)
        Finds the index at which a given subject is held in the Subjects.subjects array.
        Parameters:
        subject - string value representing the name of the subject.
        Returns:
        index that the given string is held in if the string was found, -1 otherwise.

      • subjectAtIndex

        public java.lang.String subjectAtIndex(int i)
        Finds the subject name held at the given index.
        Parameters:
        i - index that needs to be checked at.
        Returns:
        Returns the subject name as a String if found. Will display an error message and return null otherwise.

      • setSubject

        public void setSubject(java.lang.String sbOld,
                       java.lang.String sbNew)
        Changes an existing subject's name to a given value. Displays a message indicating the success/failure state.
        Parameters:
        sbOld - Old name of the subject
        sbNew - New name that the subject should take

      • noOfSubjects

        public int noOfSubjects()
        Finds the number of registered subjects in the system.
        Returns:
        the existing number of subjects.

      • showAllSubs

        public void showAllSubs()
        Displays all available subjects, registered in the system.
